entry.title: SAP DRC e-invoicing and e-way bill - INDIA Localization
entry.content:
Document and reporting compliance enables the transformation of documents created in various SAP applications into predefined exchange formats and transfer them electronically to external systems, such as to the systems of legal or tax authorities. In India e-Documents can be created for the following document types:

  • Customer invoices created from billing or accounting documents
  • Invoice verification
  • Credit memos
  • Debit memos
  • Real estate invoices

The end-to-end process requires to use one of the supported GST Suvidha Providers (GSPs). For more information about third-party service providers check SAP Note 3556797

High Level View

In India mainly TWO tasks are associated with e-document

  • e-Way Bill - You can send invoices or delivery challans electronically to the government agency to obtain a valid e-waybill number which is needed before starting goods movement. As per the Goods and Service Tax (GST) law in India, a registered taxpayer, prior to movement of goods via a conveyance, needs to inform each transaction‚Äôs details to the tax department and generate an e-way bill for such movements. There are certain exemptions and exclusions from the requirement for e-way bills. Electronic Way Bill is a valid document accompanying the transport vehicle.
  • e-invoice - You can register invoices electronically with the Invoice Registration Portal to obtain the Invoice Registration Number (IRN) and it becomes a legally valid e-invoice.

Direct integration to e-Invoicing (IRN) system via GSP. This is a licensed solution developed by SAP which will provide direct integration between the SAP ECC or SAP S/4HANA On-Prem systems or S/4HANA Cloud and the Government e-Invoicing platform via certified GSPs using the SAP Cloud Integration Platform. This will enable taxpayers to upload the payload from the backend SAP system to the e-Invoicing (IRN) portal, generate the Invoice Reference Number and link the Invoice Reference Number (IRN) with the billing document in the backend system.

FOUR Parameters to generate IRN

  • Supplier GSTIN
  • Supplier‚Äôs invoice number
  • Document Type (INV/CRN/DBN)
  • Financial year (YYYY-YY)

EIGHT Parameters to generate a QR Code

  • GSTIN of Supplier
  • GSTIN of Recipient
  • Invoice number as given by Supplier
  • Date of generation of invoice
  • Invoice value (taxable value and gross tax)
  • Number of line items
  • HSN Code of main item (the line item having highest taxable value)
  • Unique Invoice Reference Number (hash)

Key Statutory Reports (can be executed in Fiori)

  • GSTR1 Report - In India, the GSTR1 Report is a monthly return that should be filed by every registered businesses. It contains details of all outward supplies.
  • GSTR3B Report - GSTR3B is a monthly return to be filed by a registered GST taxpayer in India. It's a simplified return that consolidates the details of outward & inward supplies.
  • ITC04 Report - The form ITC04 is a declaration submitted by registered principals to report details of inputs and capital goods sent to or received from job workers during a specified tax period, in compliance with GST regulations. It stands for Input Tax Credit 04.
  • GSTR 6 Report - The GSTR 6 report provides you details of all the documents issued for distribution of input tax credit and the manner of distribution of credit and tax invoice on which credit is received.
  • Withholding Tax Reporting - Process invoice and payment documents posted within the reporting period and generate withholding tax report for submission to the tax authorities.

Pre Requisites

  • Licenses are obtained.
  • Business place setup to have GST Number
  • BP Master data equipped with IN3 (GST number) and IN2 (TIN No) Tax category.
  • For e-Invoicing as a prerequisite ODN number range should have been defined by Finance team
  • Material Master to have proper HSN/SAC codes.
  • Condition based Tax Procedure for India is already in place.
  • Tax Codes are available in system for country India.

Install and implement all the e-invoice relevant notes:

  • 3516531 - Electronic Document Processing for India - Prerequisite for SAP Note 3512964
  • 3512964 - Electronic Document Processing for India - Enabling the E-Invoice Solution for SAP Document and Reporting Compliance, Cloud Edition
  • 3516185 - Electronic Document Processing for India - E-Invoice Solution Package Creation
  • 3479282 - Electronic Document Processing for India - Prerequisite for SAP Note 3516183
  • 3516183 - Electronic Document Processing for India - AIF Enabling the E-Invoice Solution
  • 3575681 - eDocument India: DCS Integration Issue
  • 3565298 - Electronic Document Processing for India: Automatic Status Update for Electronic Documents
  • 3586310 - Electronic Document Processing for India: E-Waybill - Error message appears when you cancel the eDocument
  • 3586081 - Electronic Document Processing for India: E-Waybill - Log not found while submitting the eDocument
  • 3584664 - Electronic Document Processing for India: E-Invoice- Log not found while cancelling e-invoice
  • 3599008 - Electronic Document Processing for India - Enabling the Error Analysis for Manage Electronic Documents App ( E-Invoice Solution)
  • 3580437 - Electronic Document Processing for India: E-Invoice - Correction for eDocument India eInvoice Enhancements BAdI
  • 3637865 - Electronic Document Processing for India: E-Invoice - Viewing Error Reasons in Application Log for E-Invoice

Configuration details ‚Äì E Way bills

Configuration details ‚Äì E invoice

Cancellation Process

e-Way cancellation:

  • If the goods were never transported or are not transported as per the details furnished in the Electronic Document (eDocument).
  • In such a scenario, you cancel the eWay bill. During cancelation you enter the valid reason for cancellation. For example, the goods are not being moved, incorrect entry in the eWay bill entered. Note that for this scenario, you do not cancel the eDocument.
  • To cancel only the eWay bill and not the eDocument, do not set the Cancel eDocument checkbox.
  • If you do not set the Cancel eDocument checkbox, the system cancels the eWay bill number generated by tax authority. In such a scenario, the eDocument is still available. If required later, you can generate the eWay bill for the eDocument
  • If you set the Cancel eDocument checkbox, the system cancels the eDocument. In such a scenario you will have to additionally cancel the source document.

e-Invoice cancellation:

According to govt, IRN cancellation can only happen within 24 hours of its generation. Any cancellation after 24hrs could not be possible on IRN, however one can manually cancel the same on the GST portal before filing the returns.

If the source document needs to be canceled in SAP post 24 hours of IRN generation:

  1. Perform the ‚ÄòCancel eDocument‚Äô action under ‚ÄòMore‚Äô in EDOC_COCKPIT and it should fail with the error ‚ÄúError Code 2270: The allowed cancellation time limit is crossed, you cannot cancel the IRN.‚Äù
  2. Use the ‚ÄòAllow Cancellation‚Äô action under ‚ÄòMore‚Äô in EDOC_COCKPIT to enable the cancellation of the source document. The status will be changed to ‚ÄòALLOW_CANCEL‚Äô to allow source document cancellation.

Note: This does not have any impact on IRP portal data and only allows to cancel source document in the SAP system. After canceling the source document, ensure to cancel the outward liability while filing GSTR1 returns.

Manual correction option:

In case the automated solution is being used for an e-Invoice generation but the e-Invoice got generated offline, later eDocument status can be updated using contingency mode. The contingency report J1IGIRN can be used to upload the IRN response file back to EDOC_COCKPIT.

Download the respective response JSON file from the IRP portal and upload it in the J1IGIRN transaction. The e-Document status will get updated and associates the IRN details in e-Document tables.

I will write more blogs on other countries DRC set up and details Enjoy reading

entry.title: Oman localization in SAP S/4HANA Cloud: what matters for Implementation and beyond
entry.content:
If you are rolling out SAP S/4HANA Cloud in Oman, localization is not an afterthought‚Äîit‚Äôs your go‚Äëlive runway. SAP provides a dedicated Oman node on the Help Portal that consolidates scope, configuration, and reporting activities aligned to local law and practice.

What‚Äôs in scope

  • VAT: Generate the quarterly VAT Return using Run Statutory Reports, with predefined tax boxes for sales and purchase scenarios as well as reverse‚Äëcharge coverage for imported goods/services. You can analyze, adjust, export, and manage correction phases directly from the reporting task. 
     
  • Withholding tax (Form 18): Declaration focused on payments to foreign suppliers, supported by a guided sequence‚Äîmanage items, review, clear, prepare‚Äîplus parameters such as principal‚Äëofficer details. 
     
  • Cash flow statement: Produce the OM_CASHFLOW (indirect method) via the same Document and reporting compliance framework, using the OMCF financial statement version. 
     
  • Official document numbering (ODN): Enforce unique fiscal‚Äëyear serials for invoices and related notes through country key OM, document classes (OIN/OCN/ODN), number groups, and ranges. 
     
  • Postdated checks (PDC): End‚Äëto‚Äëend handling‚Äîreceive, present to bank/vendor, clear/bounce, reverse, and track history‚Äîusing the Bills of Exchange apps. 
     
  • Sales billing forms: Predelivered Oman templates for customer invoices and credit memos streamline compliant output.

Set‚Äëup essentials
Start with master data: maintain VAT registration numbers for company codes and business partners (format: OM + 10 digits). If applicable, define HSN/SAC codes and apply material tax indicators/classifications. Establish reporting entities and categories you‚Äôll run most often‚ÄîOM_RPG_ENT, OM_VAT_RET, OM_WHT_FORM18_DCL, OM_CASHFLOW‚Äîand complete activity‚Äëspecific parameters (for example, principal‚Äëofficer data for Form 18). 

Operate & report
Your daily driver is Run Statutory Reports: prepare the run, analyze and adjust, preview/ export, then (manually) submit to authorities and update the submission status. When you need corrections, open a new phase for a full or delta rerun as appropriate. 

Looking Ahead: E-Invoicing in Oman
Oman is moving toward mandatory e-invoicing, with a expected phased rollout starting in Q3 2026 most probably under the PEPPOL 5-corner model. This shift would require businesses to adopt structured invoice formats and integrate with accredited service providers.

Please read the blog for more details.

SAP Plans to deliver an e-invoicing solution for Oman as part of its continuous localization roadmap. Customers can expect capabilities aligned with OTA requirements, leveraging SAP Document and Reporting Compliance for seamless integration and compliance.

For the latest details and planned delivery timelines, Subscribe and stay tuned to SAP Regulatory Change Manager. This is your single source for official updates on regulatory changes and SAP‚Äôs enablement plans.

Takeaway
With pre‚Äëdelivered content across VAT, withholding tax, cash flow, ODN, PDC, and billing forms, Oman localization helps you cut risk and standardize close and reporting. Bookmark the Oman Help Portal entry and use it as your implementation playbook. 

Ready to make your Oman rollout smooth and compliant? Dive into the SAP Help Portal for detailed guidance and keep an eye on the Regulatory Change Manager for e-invoicing updates. Got questions? Share them in the comments‚Äîwe‚Äôd love to hear your perspective.

Related Blogs

Navigating Oman‚Äôs Regulatory Evolution with SAP ER... - SAP Community

SAP Document and Reporting Compliance Localization SAP S/4HANA Finance SAP S/4HANA localization as a self-service for SAP S/4HANA Cloud

entry.title: Localization in SAP S/4HANA: Strategic Enabler or Deployment Bottleneck?
entry.content:
Localization is a foundational element in global SAP rollouts, and recognizing its importance early can significantly enhance deployment outcomes. It‚Äôs not just about translating interfaces or formatting currencies‚Äîit‚Äôs about aligning enterprise systems with country-specific legal, fiscal, and operational requirements. When overlooked, localization can become a deployment bottleneck, delaying go-lives and increasing compliance risks.

Key Localization Areas and Their Impacts

  1. Statutory Compliance

Governments mandate specific reporting formats such as SAF-T, e-invoicing, and VAT declarations. SAP S/4HANA must be configured to generate these outputs accurately and on time. Non-compliance can result in penalties or operational disruptions.

  1. Taxation and Financial Reporting

Localization affects tax codes, withholding tax logic, and financial statement structures. Country-specific requirements‚Äîlike India‚Äôs GST or Saudi Arabia‚Äôs einvoicing‚Äîrequire localized configurations across Finance, Procurement, and Sales modules.

  1. Payment and Banking Formats

Local banks often require country specific payment formats (e.g., ISO 20022, MT940, CNAB). These influence integration design and middleware configurations and can delay testing if not scoped early.

  1. Language Localization

Beyond translation, cultural nuances such as date formats, decimal separators, and naming conventions impact usability and data integrity‚Äîespecially in HR and Payroll modules.

  1. Legal Document Templates

Invoices, delivery notes, and contracts must meet local legal standards. SAP Smart Forms or Adobe Forms need to be customized per country, impacting development timelines and testing cycles.

  1. Master Data Localization

Country-specific fields (e.g., tax registration numbers, local address formats) must be embedded in master data models. This affects data migration, validation, and governance.

SAP‚Äôs Localization Toolkit

SAP supports localization through country versions, localization packs, and extensibility frameworks. The SAP Globalization Services offer Solutions, tools and content to meet local requirements. However, their effectiveness depends on early planning and sometimes cross-functional collaboration spanning across various modules.

Conclusion

Localization is not a technical detail‚Äîit‚Äôs a strategic enabler. Treating it as pivotal element in your implementations ensures smoother deployments, better compliance, and higher user adoption across geographies. Successful SAP programs embed localization into design workshops, testing cycles, and governance models from day one.

It is a strategic Enabler

When localization enables companies to:

  • Comply with local laws and regulations (e.g., tax, e-invoicing, statutory reporting).
  • Operate efficiently across geographies, adapting business processes to local norms.
  • Improve user adoption by aligning interfaces and workflows with local expectations.
  • Avoid legal and financial risks through accurate configuration of country-specific requirements.

It is a deployment Bottleneck

When localization is:

  • Underestimated or delayed, it can cause project overruns.
  • Treated as a post-go-live activity, it leads to rework and compliance gaps.
  • Not scoped properly, it affects integrations with local banks, tax authorities, and third-party systems.

References

üîπCountry / Region specific localization functions

  • Country/Region-Specific Functions | SAP Help Portal

üîπStatutory Compliance

  • SAF-T Overview ‚Äì SAP Help Portal
  • SAP Document and Reporting Compliance Overview
  • Statutory Reporting Process Overview

üîπPayment and Banking Formats

  • Country/Region-Specific Payment Format Mappings
  • Configuring Payment Medium Formats

üîπLanguage localization

  • Localization and Internationalization Framework (ABAP Cloud)

üîπCreating custom electronic document

  • Creating Custom Electronic Document in DRC

entry.title: Peppol Participant Registration for Belgian Companies
entry.content:
As of January 1, 2026, Belgian companies are required to exchange electronic invoices that are compliant with the European semantic and syntactic standard (EN 16931) with their business partners. The Peppol network is the secure network for this exchange, and companies need to register a participant for their company in this network. If you‚Äôre facing the task of registering your company in the Peppol network, this blog provides you with simple tips and guidance.

For more information about the Belgian legal change, see the Regulatory Change Manager or this blog Get Ready for the Mandatory Shift to E-invoicing in Belgium ‚Äì The Clock is Ticking.

 

How Belgian companies should register

The Belgian Peppol authority, BOSA (FOD Beleid en Ondersteuning - SPF Strat√©gie & Appui), has defined Peppol Authority Specific Requirements (PASR) for its area of application, according to which companies must first and at least register as a participant in the Peppol network using their company number provided by the Belgian Crossroads Bank for Enterprises (CBE). After this initial registration, companies can register more participants using the VAT number or other identifiers, such as a SWIFT code or a GLN.

The steps are as follows:

Step 1: Mandatory registration:

First, register your company as a participant in the Peppol network using your company number with party ID type "0208".

0208: This party ID type represents the Belgian Crossroads Bank for Enterprises (CBE), which assigns unique party IDs for companies operating in Belgium, for example: 0441797980.

Here are the detailed steps on how to create a participant in SAP Document and Reporting Compliance, cloud edition: Creating a Participant for Your Company.

This creates a participant ID in the Peppol network consisting of the party ID type (it should be 0208 if it is your first participant) and the actual party ID for your company. As you can see, this participant ID is not given in advance by a government agency such as Peppol or a Peppol Access Point (AP) such as SAP.

Don‚Äôt forget to also register your company to receive electronic invoices: Registering Your Company to Receive Electronic Documents in the Peppol Network.

If your participant only exists in the Peppol network but is not yet registered to receive documents, you can send electronic documents through the Peppol network but can‚Äôt receive any.

Step 2: (Optional) additional registration:

In addition, you can register your company in the Peppol network using the company's VAT number, for example: BE0441797980, with the party ID type "9925". Other alternatives for the registration are the use of the generic ID ‚Äù0088‚Äù referring to the GLN or any other valid Peppol participant ID.

 

Migration from Hermes required

Hermes was an initiative by the Belgian government to advance electronic invoicing by enabling the receiving of electronic invoices in PDF format for receivers who are not (yet) able to process XML files.

All Belgian companies with a Belgian company number (party ID type: 0208) have been included by BOSA in the Hermes SMP (Service Metadata Publisher), which is part of the Peppol network.

If your company is ready to receive XML files, you must register your company using a Peppol Access Point like the cloud edition. However, if your company number is already used in the Hermes SMP, your Peppol service provider needs to migrate it to the SMP of the Peppol Access Point. 

Automatic migration for SAP customers

If you are using SAP Document and Reporting Compliance, cloud edition as Peppol service provider, SAP automatically migrates your company number for you from the Hermes SMP to the SMP of SAP, you don't have to perform extra steps for this migration. When you register your participant with your company number of party ID type "0208" (as described above), the system checks if this company number is already registered in the Hermes SMP. If it is the case, the cloud edition deletes the registration of your company number from the Hermes SMP and registers it automatically in the SMP used by the cloud edition.

For other concerns regarding the electronic invoicing process, you can submit a customer case under the component ‚ÄúCA-GTF-CSC-EDO-BE‚Äù.

 

 

I hope this blog was useful for you! You can leave a comment here or continue browsing our community for more blogs on SAP Document and Reporting Compliance topics.

entry.title: Streamlining North American Tax Compliance with SAP Document and Reporting Compliance
entry.content:
Join Our Webinar: Streamlining North American Tax Compliance with SAP Document and Reporting Compliance

Are you looking to simplify and strengthen your tax compliance processes in the U.S. and Canada? We‚Äôre excited to announce our upcoming webinar, ‚ÄúStreamlining U.S. and Canada Tax Compliance with SAP Document and Reporting Compliance (DRC) in SAP S/4HANA and SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition‚Äù, where our SAP DRC product experts will share insights to help you transform your compliance journey.

 

Why Attend?

In today‚Äôs complex regulatory landscape, SAP Document and Reporting Compliance (DRC) offers a powerful solution to streamline statutory reporting, eliminate data silos, and reduce operational costs for both indirect and withholding tax reporting. In this webinar, you‚Äôll discover how SAP DRC integrates with specialized tax solutions for seamless compliance in the U.S. and Canada, learn how to unify reporting across North America, gain insights into current features and the future roadmap, and understand the benefits of consolidating onto a single compliance solution‚Äîstreamlined operations, stronger controls, and lower total cost of ownership.

This is a unique opportunity to hear directly from SAP experts and gain actionable insights to enhance your compliance strategy, whether you‚Äôre using SAP S/4HANA or SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.

 

Event Details

Date: October 28, 2025

Time: 10:00 AM ‚Äì 12:30 PM PST (1:00 PM ‚Äì 3:30 PM EST) 

Registration: Sign up via the SAP Learning Hub

 

Who Can Attend?

Anyone with an S or P user ID is welcome! Feel free to invite your customers and partners to join.

Don‚Äôt Miss Out! Spaces are limited, so register now to secure your spot. We encourage you to share this invitation with colleagues, customers, and partners who could benefit from learning about SAP DRC‚Äôs capabilities.

Have questions about SAP DRC or the webinar? Drop a comment below or reach out in the SAP Community. We‚Äôre excited to connect with you on October 28!

entry.title: Customizing Your PDF with the Categories of Class A Invoices
entry.content:
Hello!  

In this blog, we will walk you through the steps of designing the new PDF templates using Adobe LiveCycle to remain compliant with R.G. N¬∞ 5762/2025 and R.G. N¬∞5764/2025 for Argentina. For more information, see Changes: New Class A invoice categories and withholding regime on the Regulatory Change Manager.

If you carry out sales, work placements or provision of services in Argentina using print character M for VAT-registered taxpayers, according to resolution R.G. N¬∞ 5762/2025 and R.G. N¬∞5764/2025, as of December 1, 2025, you must replace the existing class M invoices with the new categories of Class A invoices: 

Categories of Class A Invoices 

Description 

What you need to do 

Standard Class A 

For taxpayers meeting all fiscal and solvency requirements 

Nothing 

Class A with legend ‚ÄúOPERACI√ìN SUJETA A RETENCI√ìN‚Äù 

For taxpayers who do not meet certain requirements 

You design a new PDF template 

Class A with legend ‚ÄúPAGO EN CBU INFORMADA‚Äù 

For taxpayers who may not meet solvency criteria, requiring payments to be made to a specific, declared bank account (CBU) 

You design a new PDF template 

Prerequisites: 

  • You have‚ÄØAdobe LiveCycle Designer‚ÄØon your computer and know how to design forms with this tool.‚ÄØ 
  • You have assigned the‚ÄØExtensibility‚ÄØ(SAP_CORE_BC_EXT) authorization role for your user.‚ÄØ 

Procedure: 

1. Access the‚ÄØMaintain Form Templates‚ÄØ(F1434) app.  

2. Go to the‚ÄØPredelivered Templates‚ÄØtab and search for the following PDF form:‚ÄØ 

Document Type: 

Print Char A, B, E 

Form Template Name: 

EDO_AR_PRINT 

Data Source: 

EDOC_AR_PRINT_SRV_03 

3. Open the form template and select‚ÄØDownload.‚ÄØ 

4. Extract the downloaded ZIP file and open the‚ÄØ.xdp‚ÄØfile in the‚ÄØAdobe Livecycle Desginer.‚ÄØ 

5. In the‚ÄØAdobe LifeCycle Designer, choose the‚ÄØMaster Pages‚ÄØtab.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ 

6. From the‚ÄØObject Library, drag and drop a Text onto the PageType box of your PDF. (Note: We suggest placing the Text on the bottom left corner of the PageType box.)  

7. On the Hierarchy tab, select the new field (default name Text1) and open the context menu (right-click or press Shift+F10). Choose Rename, type Legenda, and press Enter.  

8. Edit the new Legenda text. Insert the respective text value: ‚ÄúPAGO EN CBU INFORMADA‚Äù or ‚ÄúOPERACI√ìN SUJETA A RETENCI√ìN‚Äù. 

9. On the Hierarchy tab, select the content field. 

10. After selecting the content field, open the Script Editor (default shortcut Ctrl+Shift+F5) and insert the following Javascript logic to configure Legenda field:  

if (this.resolveNode("sfHeader.content.var_PrintChar").rawValue == 'A' ) { 
  this.resolveNode("sfHeader.content.Legenda").presence = "visible"; 
} else { 
this.resolveNode("sfHeader.content.Legenda").presence = "hidden"; 
}

11. Save and name your template. 

12. Access the‚ÄØMaintain Form Templates‚ÄØ(F1434) app.‚ÄØ

13. On the‚ÄØCustom Templates‚ÄØtab, choose‚ÄØNew. Create a custom template for your form by making the following settings:‚ÄØ 

  • Form Template Name: Enter a name for your form template.‚ÄØ 
  • Language: Select the language of your form template.‚ÄØ 
  • Select Form Template File: Upload the file that you've created in‚ÄØAdobe LiveCycle Designer.‚ÄØ 
  • Data Source: EDOC_AR_PRINT_SRV_03‚ÄØ 
  • Form Type: Choose‚ÄØStandalone.‚ÄØ 

14. Save your form template.‚ÄØ 

15. In your configuration environment, use the search function to open the‚ÄØConfigure Printing Form for eInvoice‚ÄØ(103277)‚ÄØconfiguration activity and assign your custom form template to the relevant eDocument type and branch.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ 

And that's it!

You can now open the eDocument Cockpit and submit your document. The PDF form templates you created contain the new categories of Class A invoices for VAT-registered taxpayers. 

Was this post helpful? Leave a like (kudo) and share the content with your colleagues. Feel free to leave feedback, comments, or questions in the space below.    

For more information, go to Document and Reporting Compliance for Argentina on the SAP Help Portal and make sure to follow‚ÄØSAP Document and Reporting Compliance.    

 

Regards, 

Jo√£o Pedro Braun Agnes & Pedro Brum

entry.title: Learn more about Fiscalization 2.0 in Croatia: e-invoicing (B2B) , fiscalization and e-reporting
entry.content:
Regulatory Changes  
As part of the "Fiscalization 2.0" project and starting January 2026, the Croatian government is introducing B2B e-invoicing, e-reporting and fiscalization requirements. 

  • B2B/B2G e-invoicing: all businesses with VAT registration in Croatia need to send electronic invoices in the required format through an approved service provider.
  • Fiscalization: 
    • B2B/B2G invoices: issuer and receiver of e-invoices need to send the fiscal data of the invoice to authorities (digitally signed XML). 
    • B2C invoices: issuer of the e-invoice needs to send fiscal to authorities irrespective of payment method (currently required only for cash payments). 
  • E-reporting: in addition to invoicing data (fiscalization), the following reporting requirements need to be fulfilled: 
    • List of collected invoices (payment received), during reporting period (month) for invoice issuer. 
    • List of outbound deliveries for which e-invoice could not be delivered, during reporting period (month) for invoice issuer. 
    • List of rejected invoices, during reporting period (month) for invoice recipient. 

Planned SAP Solution 
SAP plans to support businesses in meeting these new requirements leveraging‚ÄØSAP Document and Reporting Compliance.‚ÄØThis cloud-based solution offers end-to-end compliance for more than 55 countries, natively embedded into the ERP, without the need for data replication and reconciliation. 
To find our more and see in action how regulatory requirements in Croatia will be supported, mark your calendar on‚ÄØOctober 16, 2025, at 3:30pm CET‚ÄØand‚ÄØjoin our webinar‚ÄØcovering the new Fiscalization, B2B e-Invoicing,‚ÄØand e-Reporting requirements in Croatia.  Register today‚ÄØand you'll:‚ÄØ 

  • Gain insight on upcoming regulatory mandates 
  • Understand how SAP Document and Reporting Compliance supports these changes 
  • Learn how to prepare your system with necessary implementation and configuration‚ÄØ 

Share with your peers, the webinar is free and can also be watched on demand afterwards.  

SAP Delivery Status  
Please monitor the Regulatory Change Manager application (further links below) to stay updated about the planned scope, delivery timeline and solution details: 

  • ‚ÄØB2B e-invoicing‚ÄØfor domestic customer invoice and supplier invoice, last mile provider required: link  
  • ‚ÄØSend Fiscalization data‚ÄØto tax authorities:‚ÄØlink 
  • ‚ÄØe-reporting‚ÄØpresenting list of collected invoices during reporting period (month) for invoice issuer:‚ÄØlink 

More information 

  • Official publication of the‚ÄØFiscalization Act in the official Gazette (in Croatian) 
  • Legal changes published by Tax Authority (in Croatian):

entry.title: Setup communication for electronic submission of statutory reports.
entry.content:
In this blog post, I would like to provide a step-by-step guide to help you configure and integrate SAP Document and Reporting Compliance, cloud edition with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition or SAP S/4HANA Private Edition, specifically for electronic submission of statutory reports.

The communication and integration of SAP Document and Reporting Compliance, cloud edition is available for a number of supported compliance reports per country / region (in both S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition and S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition or On-Premise). Through the list(s) above, all already delivered supported compliance tasks which relates to Submitting Statutory Reports Using SAP Document and Reporting Compliance, Cloud Edition as supported submission types are relevant for communication setup and application configuration. 

This blog post will provide you with a walkthrough to help you navigate through the different configuration aspects within the SAP Help portal.  With simple setup steps and the configuration of your environment you will achieve proper communication of your business system with SAP Document and Reporting Compliance, cloud edition and authentication to the tax authorities. 

The value of the integration between SAP S/4HANA business systems and SAP Document and Reporting Compliance, cloud edition lies in the fact the setup of the various steps shown below need to be done only once for communication purpose ‚Äì once done the main communication is then available for all reports.

Then, once you have completed specific application configuration for your reporting entity and communication settings specific for your report, a single click submits the report from your business system (through the application Run Statutory Reporting) and triggers the entire flow to electronic submit to the tax authority.

The configuration/set up required for each compliance report is depicted below:

Configuration on SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition business system:

  • Scope Item Activation (78L): Before starting, SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition must have the communication scenario SAP_COM_0854 available for configuration of the communication in your business system.  If your report is listed on the S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition supported compliance tasks with supported submission type as  Submitting Statutory Reports Using SAP Document and Reporting Compliance, Cloud Edition, please request activation of the scope item 78L (more information in the SAP Note 3387894).
  • Onboarding to the SAP Document and Reporting Compliance, cloud edition: If you have entitlement through your license then the next step is the Initial Setup of SAP Document and Reporting Compliance, cloud edition.
  • Connecting the Cloud Edition and the Business System: After onboarding, you must setup the Integration of SAP Document and Reporting Compliance, cloud edition with your S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition business system.
    • Communication Setup details, with all the information required, are available at:
      • setup instruction of the scope item 78L or 
      • Integrating All Other Processes and Countries/Regions with SAP S/4HANA Cloud 
  • Reporting Configuration in the Business System and Cloud Edition: The final step is the specific configuration for your report.  Here you need to complete the following two main configurations: 
    • Configure your process-specific setting and authentication method for your reports per country/region in the SAP Document and Reporting Compliance, cloud edition (SAP BTP). Please verify it per your specific report at Process-Specific Setting.
    • Configure each statutory report by following the steps in the individual configuration documentation. This can be found by navigating to the links in the Reports column in the Reports Enabled for Electronic Submission..

Configuration on SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition business systems:

  • Implementing Required SAP Notes: Before starting, the SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud Edition or On-Premise must contain the required implementation objects.  Each report includes these note details in the Supported Compliance Tasks by Country/Region table. To find this information, search by Country/Region and Task and the specific Submission Implementation Overview SAP Note. For example, if you search for United Kingdom and the task VAT Return, the Submission Implementation Overview SAP Note 3386362 appears in the Technical Information column.
  • Onboarding to the SAP Document and Reporting Compliance, cloud edition: If you have entitlement through your license then the next step is the Initial Setup of SAP Document and Reporting Compliance, cloud edition.
  • Connecting the Cloud Edition and the Business System: After onboarding, you must setup the Integration of SAP Document and Reporting Compliance, cloud edition with your S/4HANA business system.
    • Communication Setup details, with all the information required for the backend setup, are available at: Integrating All Other Processes and Countries/Regions with SAP S/4HANA 
  • Reporting Configuration in the Business System and Cloud Edition: The final step is the specific configuration for your report.  Here you need to complete the following two main configurations: 
    • Configure your process-specific setting and authentication method for your reports per country/region in the SAP Document and Reporting Compliance, cloud edition (SAP BTP). Please verify it per your specific report at Process-Specific Setting.
    • Configure each statutory report by following the steps in the individual configuration documentation. You can find the configuration documentation in SAP S/4HANA by navigating to the links in the Reports column in the Reports Enabled for Electronic Submission.

I hope this guide can provide a comprehensive understanding of the configuration steps and where to find all relevant information for the configuration of the communication setup in SAP S/4HANA Document and Reporting Compliance, cloud edition and SAP S/4HANA Cloud business systems.

Thank you and see you next time.

entry.title: Be electronic invoicing compliant in Angola with SAP Document Reporting Compliance
entry.content:
Angola Tax Authorities (Administracao Geral Tributaria) have published the technical specifications for their upcoming eInvoicing requirement, through the release of the Royal Decree (Decreto Executivo) n 683/25 published on 22nd of August 2025, which outlines the software data structure, electronic invoicing model, and technical and procedural specifications.

According to the Angola regulatory framework, taxpayers will need to use a certified electronic invoice software to generate and submit the electronic invoices to the Angola Tax Authority (AGT) in real time. The authenticity and integrity of electronically issued documents are ensured through a digital code defined by the AGT.

Angola Tax authorities will provide access to taxpayers and software producers to an eInvoicing portal (Portal do Parceiro), where specific authorizations will be granted to the parties; a testing phase will be provided. Whilst there was little indication that the deadline for large taxpayers would be delayed further to the 1st of October 2025, finally on 23rd of September, Angola Tax authorities announced a transitional period to adopt the mandate, lasting until the 1st of January 2026. Angola Tax authorities have also announced that the eInvocing portal will be made available to taxpayers by October 6th, 2025. From September 21st 2026, the obligation will be extended to all taxpayers.

As it is the case for the SAF-T mandate in Angola since 2020, the Tax authorities will require that the e-Invoicing software is certified with the Angola Tax authorities and allow for real-time transmission of information to the AGT; the certification will include the validation of the JSON for Invoices (Fatura), Credit Notes (Notas de Cr√©dito), Receipts (Recibos) and Invoice-Receipts (Faturas-Recibo). The authenticity, integrity, and non-repudiation of electronically issued documents are ensured through a digital code defined by the AGT.

Taxpayers will need to enrol for E-invoicing through the AGT portal (Portal do Contribuinte) from where the certificates (Chave Publica e Chave Privada) will be available for download.

eInvoices will also need to have the specific series which needed to be communicated to AGT. Once the eInvoice is sent to AGT, AGT sends back a notification that the invoice was received and subsequently a message that the invoice is valid or invalid and, in case of the latter, the related reason. Once eInvoice is approved, taxpayer can send it to the recipient. AGT does not send the eInvoice to final recipient. eInvoices need to be capable of being printed in PDF including a QR code via the eInvocing software which will enable to check the invoice details.

Below picture depicts the Angola eInvoicing model:

Angola Tax authorities technical specifications for eInvoicing provide 7 different API REST services for integration with SIGT (Integrated Tax management system) and eInvocing softwares:

registerInvoice (registarFactura),

getStatus (obterEstado),

listInvoices (listarFacturas),

consultInvoice (consultarFactura),

requestSeries (solicitarSerie),

listSeries (listarSeries),

validateDocument (validarDocumento).   

Crimson Technology Partners has developed the SAP Document Reporting Compliance solution to respond to the eInvoicing mandate of Angola tax authorities. The solution is meeting the requirements of the Angola Tax authorities, and is ready to connect to the AGT platform, as soon as it is released.

SAP Document Reporting Compliance solutions by Crimson Technology partners respect the principle of consistent user experience across countries and uniform functionality across countries, without introducing any custom program or transaction code.

Our standard SAP Document Reporting Compliance Solution, provides a full staging area for testing, training and handbooks for your organisation, providing the following benefits:

  • Single Global Process using Document Reporting Compliance
  • E2E compliant solution built with the Angola Tax authorities
  • Generation of electronic invoices in XML format (FI, SD) for B2B and B2G
  • Self-billing scenario's
  • FICA and RE-FX billing
  • Manual or automated invoice submission
  • Receiving of e-invoices in XML format and Integration to VIM Software
  • Human Readable PDF in Cockpit for incoming invoices

The following image shows the high-level architecture of SAP Document Reporting Compliance Solution for Angola eInvoicing:

The following image shows the ERP detail of the outbound and inbound eInvocing process of SAP Document Reporting Compliance Solution for Angola:

The following image shows the ERP detail of the outbound eInvocing process of SAP Document Reporting Compliance Solution for Angola:

The following image shows the ERP detail of the inbound eInvocing process of SAP Document Reporting Compliance Solution for Angola:

In terms of implementation time, below is an estimate of project timeline with high-level phases:

Compatible with ECC, S/4HANA & S/4 Cloud, this is another step on the journey of global electronic invoicing across borders, in particular, for Africa where Nigeria just introduced a Peppol aligned eInvoicing system, and Morocco will introduce a pre-clearance model by 2026, following on Ghana, Kenya, and Ivory Coast.

Look out next for our Ivory Coast and Morocco solution!

entry.title: Configuration and Submission of your UK VAT Return
entry.content:
In this blog post, I would like to guide you on how to configure and integrate SAP Document and Reporting Compliance, cloud edition with your business system to electronically submit the VAT return to the tax authorities in the United Kingdom.

One of the values of integrating your business systems with the cloud edition is the fact that the integration between systems needs to be done only once ‚Äì after you are done, the systems are integrated and available for all of your reports.

This means that once you have completed the configuration specific for your reporting entity and made the communication settings specific for your tax authority, a single click in the Run Statutory Reports app submits the report from your business system and triggers the entire flow to electronically submit the VAT return report to HMRC, the tax authority.

For detailed information on how to integrate your business system with the cloud edition, you can access the Setup communication for electronic submission of s... - SAP Community blog post.

When doing the process-specific configuration, you are required to enter your HMRC credentials in the Manage Communication Settings app. If you're VAT-registered, HMRC automatically signs up new businesses for MTD for VAT, unless you're exempt or have applied for exemption. In both cases, consider the following:

  • Use compatible software: You must keep your digital VAT records and submit VAT returns using MTD-compatible software. SAP S/4HANA products provide the end-to-end process of recording your financial transactions, generating the VAT return, and submitting the report electronically using the mandated API from HMRC in the correct JSON file format.
  • Sign in with your Government Gateway ID: This is your credential for accessing HMRC services. If you don‚Äôt have one, you can create a Government Gateway account. For more information, see Create a Government Gateway account.
  • Link your software to HMRC: Authorize your system to communicate with HMRC using your Government Gateway credentials. For more information, see Granting Permission to Submit the VAT Return Report Electronically.

When performing the steps in the Manage Communication Settings app of the cloud edition, you enter your credentials for the UK MTD, that is, your VAT registration number. For more information, see Managing Communication Settings.

In your first submission, you will be prompted to enter your credentials in the HMRC portal. You will see a message asking if SAP Document and Reporting Compliance, cloud edition, is authorized to access the HMRC portal. Please select "Yes".

For 18 months after the initial authorization, you will not need to enter a username and password for submissions again. The VAT return report is submitted as soon as you select the Submit option in the Run Statutory Reports app. However, the authorization needs to be renewed every 18 months. 

If, within those 18 months, the authorization grants are not valid at the time of submission for any reason, you will be redirected to HMRC to renew the access tokens before submission can take place.

 

END-TO-END PROCESS

Once you have integrated both systems and made the process-specific configuration, you can generate and submit the VAT return report to HMRC, as follows:

1 ‚Äì Access the Run Statutory Reports app and enter the following parameters:

  • Reporting Entity
  • Report Name: GB_VAT_DCL
  • Reporting Year

2 - Choose Go.

 

3 - After running and completing the activities listed, for example, Manage Tax Items, select the Prepare VAT Return Statement (Great Britain) activity.

 

4 - Select New Run, check the default selection criteria, and make changes if required.

 

5 - After executing the report and checking the VAT return statement, choose Submit.

 

TROUBLESHOOTING

[1] If you are moving from SAP Document and Reporting Compliance service to SAP Document and Reporting Compliance, cloud edition, you can find more information in  Moving to SAP Document and Reporting Compliance, Cloud Edition.

Be aware that you have to apply all referred SAP Notes and prerequisites of SAP Note 3386362 - UK VAT Return Submission: Implementation Overview.

For more information, you can also access the Frequently Asked Questions section of the Moving to SAP Document and Reporting Compliance, Cloud Edition. See Frequently Asked Questions.

 

[2] To enforce a new redirection:

1. Access the Manage Communication Settings - External Parties app in SAP Document and Reporting Compliance, cloud edition.

2. Search by your Identification number and choose the respective entry.

3.  Choose the ‚ÄúX‚Äù (Delete Key) from the Authentication Setting section. A pop-up window appears, and you confirm your action.

 

 

 4. The authentication setting status is updated to ‚ÄúIncomplete‚Äù.

 

 5. Choose + (‚ÄúAdd Authentication Setting‚Äù) and, in the pop-up window, choose Authorization Code Flow as the authentication setting.

 

 

 6. The authentication setting status is updated to ‚ÄúComplete‚Äù.

 

Wait a few minutes before submitting your report to allow any cached items to be erased.

7. You can now resubmit your report using the Run Statutory Reports app. 

 

Hopefully, this blog post gave you a detailed walkthrough of the steps needed to set up and configure the automatic electronic submission of the VAT Return. With this one-time setup, you can benefit from a seamless integration between your business system and SAP Document and Reporting Compliance, cloud edition.

The integration with the cloud edition is available for a number of supported compliance reports per country/region. To know the reports supported with each business system, access the Supported Compliance Tasks and use the search and filter options to find the reports you want to submit and the business system you have.

entry.title: Recap: SAP Document and Reporting Compliance Virtual Summit 2025 ‚Äì Insights and Impact
entry.content:
It began with a simple question in the chat: ‚ÄúWhere are you joining from?‚Äù Within moments, responses lit up the screen ‚Äî Bangalore, Tokyo, Singapore. Then came S√£o Leopoldo, Paris, Buenos Aires, and Berlin. The SAP Document and Reporting Compliance Virtual Summit 2025 was underway, and it was clear: this isn‚Äôt just an annual virtual event ‚Äî it is truly a global dialogue.

From the first keynote to the final Q&A, the summit reflected the shared challenges and ambitions of compliance professionals across continents. Whether navigating new tax mandates or exploring AI-powered reporting, this community of SAP customers, partners and SAP experts came together on September 25 to learn, connect, and shape the future of digital compliance.

With 4,400 registrants and over 1,350 participants dialing-in from nearly every continent, this year‚Äôs summit reaffirmed its role as a global platform for collaboration, innovation, and learning.

From Strategy to Execution: Empowering Global Compliance

The event opened with a keynote by Sergey Shvedov, SVP and Chief Product Officer of SAP Globalization, who outlined SAP‚Äôs strategy on end-to-end compliance worldwide. He emphasized SAP‚Äôs four-pillar strategy: Global coverage, continuous legal updates, extensibility, and audit-ready processes to help customers navigate evolving regulatory landscapes.

Customer Voices: Real-World Journeys and Lessons

This year‚Äôs summit spotlighted customer stories that brought SAP Document and Reporting Compliance to life:

  • Jubin Sharma from Nestl√© shared their journey implementing SAP Document and Reporting Compliance to streamline tax and reporting processes across multiple regions.
  • Pedro Castro from SumUp demonstrated how SAP Document and Reporting Compliance accelerated invoice processing and payment cycles, improving operational agility.
  • Crimson Partners, joined by their customer Roche, delivered a joint session that showcased how partner-driven expertise can help customers scale compliance globally with one process and one solution. While Roche leverages Crimson‚Äôs support in specific countries, the session highlighted how collaborative planning and technical alignment ‚Äî enabled by SAP Document and Reporting Compliance ‚Äî can streamline implementation and daily operations across diverse jurisdictions.

These sessions underscored how SAP Document and Reporting Compliance is not just a compliance tool, but a strategic enabler for transforming compliance operations.

Innovation in Action and Practical Guidance

The event also brought SAP experts to address the latest roadmap updates and product enhancements. Topics ranged from smarter e-invoicing and AI-driven reporting to localization of cash flow statements and extensibility frameworks for universal coverage.

The summit concluded with a practical overview session offering configuration tips and implementation best practices ‚Äî making the full set of recordings a valuable resource for both strategic and hands-on guidance.

Access the Information Package

All session recordings and slides are now available in the Information Package. Whether you attended live or are catching up, we invite you to explore the materials and continue the conversation.

Thank you to all the attendees, speakers, customers and partners who contributed to making this event a resounding success. Your participation and engagement are the driving force of this community.

While the summit is wrapped up, the journey towards mastering compliance is ongoing. Stay tuned for upcoming events, webinars, and resources from SAP that will continue to support your compliance journey.

We look forward to welcoming you to our next events as we continue to unlock the future of compliance together.

Learn more about SAP‚Äôs localized solutions at sap.com/localization and join our Localization community.

entry.title: SAP Document and Reporting Compliance Belgium: Electronic Invoice in Utilities using Extensibility
entry.content:
You want to enable your system to create electronic documents for invoices posted in Utilities using SAP Document and Reporting Compliance. In this blog, we‚Äôll show you an example on how this can be achieved using extensibility.  

Before you begin ensure that you have implemented the SAP Notes listed in 2424886 - Electronic Document Processing for Belgium: Implementation Overview. You can also refer the SAP Help Portal for more information, see Electronic Document Processing.
Ensure you have also implemented the SAP Notes listed in 2736880 - eDocument EU PEPPOL: Overview note for IS-U.

Steps to Create Electronic Documents

  • Create eDocument Class
    1. Create 'ZCL_EDOCUMENT_BE_ISU' eDocument class by inheriting CL_EDOCUMENT_EU_ISU class.
    2. Add the CONSTRUCTOR method in the ZCL_EDOCUMENT_BE_ISU eDocument class to map the 'Z' eDocument IS-U class name to the field ms_edocument-edocument_class.‚ÄØ
    3. Redefine the method DETERMINE_PROCESS to assign the processes BEINV and BEINVIN.
    4. Use the table TFK003EDOC to configure eDocument type against the accounting document type.
    Example:

    Country/Region 

    Application Area 

    Document Type 

    eDocument Type 

    IN 

    Utility Company 

    FA 

    BE_INV 

    ‚ÄØ5. Add the class CL_EDOC_PROCESS as Friends of 'ZCL_EDOCUMENT_BE_ISU' eDocument class.‚ÄØ

    Sample Code for CONSTRUCTOR and DETERMINE_PROCESS method:  
    Constructor method signature: 

METHOD constructor.
 super->constructor( io_source_data                 = io_source_data
                      iv_edoc_guid                   = iv_edoc_guid
                      iv_land                        = iv_land
                      iv_update_task                 = iv_update_task
                      iv_generic_badi_filter_adaptor = iv_generic_badi_filter_adaptor
                      iv_simulate_for_email_option = iv_simulate_for_email_option ).

  ms_edocument-land                   = 'BE'.
  ms_edocument-edocument_class        = 'ZCL_EDOCUMENT_BE_ISU'.
ENDMETHOD.
METHOD determine_process.
    CASE ms_edocument-edoc_type.
      WHEN 'BE_INVIN'.
        ms_edocument-process = 'BEINVIN'.
        ms_edocument-process_version = '0001'.
      WHEN OTHERS.
        CASE ms_edocument-interface_type.
          WHEN 'AIF_PROXY' OR 'STANDARD'.
            ms_edocument-process = 'BEINV'.
*           reference process is 'EUINV'
            ms_edocument-process_version = '0001'.
          WHEN OTHERS.
            MESSAGE e162(edocument) INTO gv_error_txt.
            raise_edoc_exception( ).
        ENDCASE.
    ENDCASE.
ENDMETHOD.

 

  • Create Factory Class
    1. Create a 'Z' factory class to get the instance of eDocument IS-U class by inheriting CL_EDOC_FACTORY class and redefine its method CREATE_EDOC_INSTANCE. 
    Example: ZCL_EDOC_FACTORY_BE_ISU
    2. Configure this 'Z' eDocument factory class in the view EDOFACTORYV using the transaction SM30.

    Source Type‚ÄØ 

    Factory Class‚ÄØ 

    ISU_INVOIC‚ÄØ 

    ‚ÄòZ‚Äô factory class name (your factory class that you just created)‚ÄØ 


    Sample Code:
METHOD create_edoc_instances.

    DATA: lv_land_iso      TYPE edoc_land,
          lv_error_txt     TYPE string,
          ls_source_header TYPE edoc_src_header,
          lo_edocument     TYPE REF TO zcl_edocument_be_isu.

    CLEAR: lv_land_iso,
           lv_error_txt,
           ls_source_header,
           lo_edocument,
           et_edocument_obj.

* Country
    ls_source_header = io_source->get_header( ).
    CALL FUNCTION 'COUNTRY_CODE_SAP_TO_ISO'
      EXPORTING
        sap_code  = ls_source_header-land
      IMPORTING
        iso_code  = lv_land_iso
      EXCEPTIONS
        not_found = 1
        OTHERS    = 2.
    IF sy-subrc <> 0.
      MESSAGE e881(b1) WITH ls_source_header-land INTO lv_error_txt.
    ENDIF.
    IF lv_land_iso <> 'BE'.
      RETURN.
    ENDIF.

    CREATE OBJECT lo_edocument 
      EXPORTING
        io_source_data = io_source
        iv_update_task = iv_update_task.

    APPEND lo_edocument TO et_edocument_obj.

  ENDMETHOD.

  • Mapping Class
    1. We have a generic mapping class CL_EDOC_MAP_UBL_ISU. If you need to enhance the mapping logic, you can use the EDOC_ADAPTOR BAdI's method SET_OUTPUT_DATA. For more details, refer to Enhancements for Electronic Documents.
    Alternatively, you can implement your own custom mapping class. 
    2. Configure your mapping class in the view EDOMAPCLASSDETV using the transaction SM30.‚ÄØ
    Example:

    eDocument Process 

    Version 

    Interface ID 

    eDocument Type 

    Source Type 

    Mapping Class 

    EUINV 

    1 

    UBL_INVOICE_TRANSM

    BE_INV 

    ISU_INVOIC 

    <Your Z mapping class or CL_EDOC_MAP_UBL_ISU> 

     

  • Maintain the Required Customizations
    Apart from maintaining Master Data, Customizing and Integration as explained in the SAP Help Portal, you must also configure the company code for the following IS-U source type.

    1.  Activate company code for ISU_INVOIC source type in the view EDOCOMPANYACTIV for eDocument creation.
    Example:

    Company Code‚ÄØ 

    Source Type‚ÄØ 

    Application Active‚ÄØ 

    <Your company code>‚ÄØ 

    ISU_INVOICE‚ÄØ 

    X‚ÄØ 


By following these steps, you can efficiently create electronic documents for invoices in the utilities sector, ensuring compliance and enhancing operational efficiency. 

Don't forget to test it thoroughly. 

We hope this blog post was useful for you! You can leave a comment here or continue browsing our‚ÄØcommunity‚ÄØfor more blog posts on SAP Document and Reporting Compliance topics. 

Looking forward to seeing you here again!

entry.title: Enhancing Your Understanding of Peru's Inventory and Balance Ledger Report: Updates to Documentation
entry.content:
I‚Äôm Mait√™, a User Assistance Developer in SAP Globalization, working in the financial area. As part of my role, I‚Äôm happy to share with you the latest updates to the documentation for the Peru Inventory and Balance Ledger report in SAP Document and Reporting Compliance. Explore the highlights below to discover how these improvements can help with the report!

The Report

The Peru Inventory and Balance Ledger report is currently available in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition, and SAP S/4HANA. The report organizes general ledger balances into subledgers across fourteen electronic accounting books, following Peru's PCGE (Plan Contable General Empresarial) and SUNAT (Superintendencia Nacional de Aduanas y de Administraci√≥n Tributaria) requirements. 

Recent Documentation Improvements

To help you better understand the Inventory and Balance Ledger report, we have enhanced our documentation with a new page. This addition provides details on specific fields, grouped by configuration settings and characteristics. Our goal is to clarify the relationships between certain fields in the report output and the configurations made by you before running the report.

New page added to the SAP Help Portal

 

Structured Tables for Clarity

We've organized the documentation into five tables:

  • Table 1:  Fields Related to Financial Statement Version (FSV) and G/L Account Hierarchies

This table highlights fields associated with hierarchy configurations from the app Manage Global Hierarchies, focusing on Financial Statement Versions and G/L Account hierarchy types.

  • Table 2: Fields Related to Alternative Chart of Accounts (COA)

This table details fields related to the alternative COA settings used for specific legal reporting requirements in Peru.

  • Table 3: Fields Tax Number Type and Tax Number Related to Alternative Chart of Accounts (COA)

This table specifies details on tax-related fields which are associated with the alternative COA settings.

  • Table 4: Other Fields in the Report

This table provides information about other fields, explaining their data sources and how the system populates them.

  • Table 5: Optional Fields in the Report

Finally, this table lists optional fields included in our solution and explains how they are populated, though they are not required by SUNAT.

Conclusion

We really hope these documentation updates make your journey through the Inventory and Balance Ledger report easier and more efficient. You can find them in the report documentation linked below:

  • SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition: Inventory and Balance Ledger 
  • SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition and SAP S/4HANA: Inventory and Balance Ledger

Feel free to explore these tables on the SAP Help Portal and share your questions or feedback in the comments. They are most welcome!

Last but not least, follow the SAP Document and Reporting Compliance community tag for the latest updates. 

Thank you and until next time,

Mait√™ Bohn

entry.title: Como a Reforma Tribut√°ria no Brasil Impacta os usu√°rios SAP
entry.content:

A reforma tribut√°ria no Brasil √© um tema de grande relev√¢ncia para empresas que precisam se adaptar a estas mudan√ßas legais. Para os usu√°rios SAP, √© importante entender como a reforma afeta os processos log√≠sticos e financeiros, estar ciente dos prazos de implanta√ß√£o e saber quais s√£o as solu√ß√µes providas pela SAP para garantir uma transi√ß√£o tranquila.

Cronograma de Implementa√ß√£o da Reforma

  • 2026: A reforma tribut√°ria come√ßa a ser testada, com taxas iniciais mais baixas de 0,9% para a Contribui√ß√£o sobre Bens e Servi√ßos (CBS) e 0,1% para o Imposto sobre Bens e Servi√ßos (IBS).
  • 2027: A CBS passa a valer, substituindo PIS e Cofins. A al√≠quota de IPI ser√° zerada, exceto para produtos industrializados na ZFM.
  • 2028: √öltimo ano de ICMS e ISS sem altera√ß√£o.

Recomendamos fortemente o uso da ferramenta Note Analyzer para organizar a implementa√ß√£o das SAP Notes desta solu√ß√£o. Consulte a SAP Note 3200109 para obter instru√ß√µes sobre essa ferramenta e utilize o arquivo XML anexo √† SAP Note 3561376 para relacionar as entregas da SAP para a Reforma Tribut√°ria do Brasil. A vers√£o mais recente do Note Analyzer introduz um recurso que exibe a ordem de implementa√ß√£o na coluna "coment√°rios" ap√≥s a importa√ß√£o do XML. Siga esta ordem, mesmo que algumas SAP Notes n√£o sejam relevantes para o seu neg√≥cio. Observe que a ferramenta fornece a ordem correta, mas n√£o uma lista completa dos pr√©-requisitos das SAP Notes. Assim, an√°lises adicionais podem ser necess√°rias para lidar com poss√≠veis depend√™ncias.

Observa√ß√µes importantes durante a implementa√ß√£o das SAP notes
Para cada nota SAP que ser√° implementada, reserve um momento para ler o seu conte√∫do em texto. Desta forma, ser√° poss√≠vel se informar sobre notas pr√©-requisito conhecidas, passos manuais a serem executados antes ou depois da implementa√ß√£o autom√°tica das instru√ß√µes de corre√ß√£o, assim como ficar ciente de outras instru√ß√µes. A leitura do conte√∫do de cada nota a ser implementada pode evitar problemas de implementa√ß√£o e a necessidade de retrabalho.
Al√©m disso, √© muito importante n√£o prosseguir para a implementa√ß√£o de SAP notes subsequentes deixando notas anteriores incorretamente implementadas no sistema (status incompletely implemented), pois isso leva a um sistema corrompido e sem os contextos e objetos necess√°rios para futuras implementa√ß√µes. Portanto, ao implementar uma lista de SAP Notes, assegure-se de que cada nota est√° sendo implementada corretamente e completamente.

Recursos de Apoio

  • SAP Note 3561376 - Tax Reform Leading SAP Note para leitura: Descreve a estrat√©gia de entrega e suporte para a solu√ß√£o de Reforma Tribut√°ria do Brasil. Esta nota, de atualiza√ß√£o frequente, lista as entregas da solu√ß√£o conforme s√£o liberadas para clientes. Assim, anexado a ela est√° o arquivo XML sempre atualizado para o uso no Note Analyzer, auxiliando a implementa√ß√£o das SAP Notes na ordem adequada.
  • SAP Note 3637842 - Brazil Tax Reform - Testing Limitations with SEFAZ para leitura: Esta SAP Note informativa destaca os processos ainda n√£o suportados pela SAP relacionados √† Reforma Tribut√°ria no Brasil, especialmente sobre cen√°rios a serem testados com a SEFAZ. Esta nota ser√° atualizada regularmente.
  • KBA 3642384 - Brazil Tax Reform Troubleshooting Guide: Al√©m de explicar sobre a entrega da SAP e trazer os links diretos da plataforma Regulatory Change Manager para os assuntos da Reforma Tribut√°ria, este KBA de Troubleshooting auxilia a resolver os poss√≠veis problemas j√° identificados durante a implementa√ß√£o das SAP notes. SAP S/4HANA - Help Portal

Prazo de Implementa√ß√£o para clientes

Valida√ß√£o por parte do governo

entry.title: How the Tax Reform in Brazil Impacts SAP Users
entry.content:
Clique aqui para a vers√£o em portugu√™s.

Tax reform in Brazil is a topic of great relevance for companies that need to adapt to these legal changes. For SAP users, it is important to understand how the reform affects logistical and financial processes, be aware of implementation deadlines, and know what solutions SAP provides to ensure a smooth transition.

Implementation Timeline of the Tax Reform

  • 2026: The tax reform begins to be tested, with initial lower rates of 0.9% for the Contribution on Goods and Services (CBS) and 0.1% for the Tax on Goods and Services (IBS).
  • 2027: CBS comes into effect, replacing PIS and Cofins. The IPI rate will be zeroed, except for industrialized products in the ZFM.
  • 2028: Last year of ICMS and ISS without changes.
  • 2029: Gradual elimination of ICMS and ISS, with an annual reduction of 10% in their rates, as part of the replacement by IBS.
  • 2033: Full adoption of the new tax regime, with the extinction of ICMS and ISS.

SAP Deliverables
SAP is committed to supporting its clients during the transition to the new tax model. SAP solutions are being updated to meet the new legal requirements, ensuring that companies can adapt to the changes.

SNOTE: Note Analyzer tool
We strongly recommend using the Note Analyzer tool to organize the implementation of SAP Notes for this solution. Refer to SAP Note 3200109 for instructions on this tool and use the XML file attached to SAP Note 3561376 to list the SAP deliverables for Brazil's Tax Reform. The latest version of Note Analyzer introduces a feature that displays the implementation order in the "comments" column after importing the XML. Follow this order, even if some SAP Notes are not relevant to your business. Note that the tool provides the correct order but not a complete list of prerequisites for the SAP Notes. Therefore, additional analysis may be necessary to address potential dependencies.

Important observations during the implementation of SAP notes
For each SAP Note to be implemented, take a moment to read its textual content. This way, you can become informed about known prerequisite notes, manual steps to be executed before or after the automatic implementation of correction instructions, and be aware of other instructions. Reading the content of each note to be implemented can help avoid implementation issues and the need for rework.
Moreover, it is crucial not to proceed with the implementation of subsequent SAP Notes, leaving previous notes incorrectly implemented in the system (status: incompletely implemented), as this leads to a corrupted system and the absence of necessary contexts and objects for future implementations. Therefore, when implementing a list of SAP Notes, ensure that each note is implemented correctly and completely.

Support Resources
SAP provides several support resources, including:

  • SAP Work Zone - Brazil - Tax Reform Localization: It allows SAP customers and partners to share information and collaborate on matters related to the Tax Reform. This space is updated daily.
  • The Regulatory Change Manager tool: Announcements of legal changes and planning of solution deliverables.
  • SAP Note 3561376 - Tax Reform Leading SAP Note for reading: It describes the delivery and support strategy for the Brazil Tax Reform solution. This frequently updated SAP Note lists the solution deliverables as they are released to customers. Attached to it is an always-updated XML file to be used on the Note Analyzer, assisting you in the implementation of SAP Notes in the proper order.
  • SAP Note 3637842 - Brazil Tax Reform - Testing Limitations with SEFAZ for reading: This informational SAP Note highlights the processes not yet supported by SAP related to the Tax Reform in Brazil, especially regarding scenarios to be tested with SEFAZ. This note will be updated regularly.
  • KBA 3642384 - Brazil Tax Reform Troubleshooting Guide: In addition to explaining SAP's deliverables and providing direct links to the Regulatory Change Manager platform for Tax Reform topics, this Troubleshooting KBA helps resolve potential issues already identified during the implementation of SAP Notes. By offering solutions to common problems, this KBA is continuously updated to include new information.

SAP ERP - Help Portal

  • Tax Groups and Tax Types Added to Nota Fiscal
  • CBS and IBS Taxes as Statistical Values in Nota Fiscal
  • Define Tax Situation for CBS and IBS
  • CBS and IBS Tax Situation for Sales
  • Base Amount Changes for CBS and IBS Using TAXBRA
  • Enablement of NBS for CBS and IBS Determination in Purchasing Scenarios
  • Base Amount Changes for CBS and IBS Using TAXBRJ Pricing Procedure
  • Fields Added to Nota Fiscal for CBS and IBS Taxes
  • Nominal Rate Calculation and Nota Fiscal Texts for CBS and IBS in Nota Fiscal Writer
  • Base Amount Changes for CBS and IBS Using RVABRA and RVXBRA Pricing Procedures
  • Determine Tax Situation for CBS and IBS Business Add-In
  • Fields Added for Nominal Rates in Nota Fiscal BAdI Structure
  • Field Added to Nota Fiscal Table for IBS Tax Calculation
  • CBS and IBS Tax Situation for Purchasing
  • Enhanced Tax Determination with Tax Situation for CBS and IBS for Sales Processes
  • Fields Added to Nota Fiscal BAdI and BAPIs structures
  • CBS and IBS Tax Situation for Goods Movement

SAP S/4HANA - Help Portal

  • Tax Groups and Tax Types Added to Nota Fiscal
  • CBS and IBS Taxes as Statistical Values in Nota Fiscal
  • Define Tax Situation for CBS and IBS
  • CBS and IBS Tax Situation for Sales
  • Base Amount Changes for CBS and IBS Using TAXBRA
  • Enablement of NBS for CBS and IBS Determination in Purchasing Scenarios
  • Base Amount Changes for CBS and IBS Using TAXBRJ Pricing Procedure
  • Fields Added to Nota Fiscal for CBS and IBS Taxes
  • Nominal Rate Calculation and Nota Fiscal Texts for CBS and IBS in Nota Fiscal Writer
  • Base Amount Changes for CBS and IBS Using RVABRA and RVXBRA Pricing Procedures
  • Determine Tax Situation for CBS and IBS Business Add-In
  • Fields Added for Nominal Rates in Nota Fiscal BAdI Structure
  • Field Added to Nota Fiscal Table for IBS Tax Calculation
  • CBS and IBS Tax Situation for Purchasing
  • Enhanced Tax Determination with Tax Situation for CBS and IBS for Sales Processes
  • Fields Added to Nota Fiscal BAdI and BAPIs structures
  • CBS and IBS Tax Situation for Goods Movement

Implementation Deadline for Customers
SAP customers must have the SAP solutions related to the tax reform fully implemented and tested by December 2025 to ensure compliance with the new obligations starting from January 2026.

Government Validation
Currently, it is possible to test document approval with the fields for the new taxes in SEFAZ's homologation environment, and optionally, to send them in production as well. SEFAZ's production environment will begin validating the new XML fields of NF-e related to the tax reform taxes starting in January 2026. Until that date, filling out these new fields is optional and, even if filled, should not cause rejection in NF-e approval.
From January 2026, filling out the fields for the new taxes will be mandatory, with legal significance, for electronic tax documents in the production environment. Non-compliance may lead to the rejection of the invoices.

Conclusion
The tax reform in Brazil represents a significant legal change, so be mindful of the deadline for compliance.
The SAP informational notes listed above and the troubleshooting KBA will be continuously updated to ensure you have access to relevant information as you update your system.
Utilize the available resources and engage in the Work Zone to clarify any doubts.

entry.title: Electronic Invoices in Poland (KSeF 2.0) with SAP Document and Reporting Compliance
entry.content:
Starting in February or April 2026, depending on your revenue, all Polish invoices will be required to be exchanged through KSeF. Following the postponement of the mandate originally planned for 2024, the Ministry of Finance has released a new KSeF system, KSeF 2.0 with the following timelines:

  • February 1, 2026:
    • Submission of electronic invoices to KSeF is obligatory for companies whose sales value in the previous tax year exceeded PLN 200 million.
    • Receiving e-invoices from KSeF is obligatory for all.

  • April 1, 2026 - submission of electronic invoices to KSeF is obligatory for others.

SAP has therefore updated its global solution SAP Document and Reporting Compliance to enable electronic invoices through KSeF 2.0.  To explore the latest functionalities and gain insights to accelerate your implementation, even if you have already implemented KSeF 1.0, we invite you to join our SAP hosted complimentary webinar:

üóìÔ∏è Thursday, November 20, 2025

‚åöÔ∏è 3:00 PM Central European Time

‚è≥1 hour

üìãRegister here

Important note: Customers deploying KSeF 2.0 need to implement some technical pre-requisites (if they don't have already in their system). Further details can be found here (access to this page can be requested via email). 

Furher links and references:

  • Overview video: link 
  • Customer-facing WorkZone: link. 
  • Regulatory change manager: latest link to Regulatory Change Manager. ‚ÄôProduct impact‚Äô tab has the timeline for the different systems and requirements (including upcoming ones such e-invoicing for foreign VAT Registrations, invoices visualisation in PDF with KSeF reference and QR code, validation of KSeF availability - contingency process, exclusion of B2C invoices, etc.). 
        - MoF website:https://ksef.podatki.gov.pl/
        - KSeF 2.0 test environment (EN) https://ksef-test.mf.gov.pl/
  • Webinar replay (solution overview and demo KSeF 1.0 from 28 February 2023)
    Title: Electronic Invoices in Poland (KSeF) are now supported with SAP Document and Reporting Compliance.
    Link: https://sapvideoa35699dc5.hana.ondemand.com/?entry_id=1_6lralmxa
